questions.question: 1. How does the Fermi energy level of an intrinsic semiconductor change with increasing temperature?
2. What happens to the carrier concentration in an intrinsic semiconductor as the temperature rises?
3. In an n-type semiconductor, what effect does increasing temperature have on the Fermi energy level?

answers.a: It moves closer to the conduction band
answers.b: It moves closer to the valence band
answers.d: It moves away from the conduction band

questions.question: 4. How does the Fermi energy level of a p-type semiconductor shift with increasing temperature?

answers.a: It moves closer to the conduction band
answers.b: It moves closer to the valence band
answers.d: It moves away from the valence band

questions.question: 5. Which factor primarily controls the variation of carrier concentration with temperature in a semiconductor?
6. At very high temperatures, how does the carrier concentration in an intrinsic semiconductor behave?
7. What is the relationship between the Fermi energy level and carrier concentration in an n-type semiconductor as temperature increases?

answers.a: Carrier concentration increases and Fermi level moves closer to conduction band
answers.b: Carrier concentration decreases and Fermi level moves closer to conduction band
answers.c: Carrier concentration remains constant and Fermi level moves away from conduction band
answers.d: Carrier concentration decreases and Fermi level moves closer to valence band

questions.question: 8. How does the Fermi energy level in a p-type semiconductor compare to the intrinsic Fermi level at high temperatures?

answers.a: It is closer to the valence band
answers.b: It is closer to the conduction band
answers.c: It is at the same position
answers.d: It moves away from both bands
